Sure, here are some examples:

1. "Love is all you need": This misconception that love is enough to sustain a relationship has led some individuals to stay in toxic or abusive relationships. They believe that if they just love their partner enough, everything else will work out, even if the partner is emotionally or physically harmful.

2. "Your partner should complete you": This belief that a romantic partner should be a soulmate who fulfills all your emotional and social needs has led to disappointment and pressure on partners to be perfect. This can cause conflict and tension in the relationship and unrealistic expectations can cause frustration and dissatisfaction.

3. "Jealousy is a sign of love": This misconception about love and jealousy has caused many partners to feel insecure, possessive, and controlling in their relationships. Jealousy can be harmful and can lead to issues such as stalking, domestic violence, and unhealthy obsessions.

4. "Fairy tale endings": This belief that life is like a fairy tale, where everything works out perfectly, has led to disappointment and unhappiness when faced with the realities of relationship or family life. There are ups and downs in every relationship and unrealistic expectations or disappointment can cause stress and turmoil in the relationship.

5. "Opposites attract": This misconception about compatibility can lead to conflict and disagreement in relationships. While it is true that differences can bring excitement to a relationship, incompatible differences can cause arguments, misunderstandings, and stress. Mutual interest and respect are important factors to consider. 

These misunderstandings about romance have fulfilled the hearts of individuals with unrealistic expectations and forced couples into tough situations.
